title: Comparative and Absolute Advantages - Art and Zed

content.question: Dr. Art and Dr. Zed jointly own an outpatient surgery practice. Dr. Art takes <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> hours to perform knee surgery and <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> hour to perform elbow surgery. Dr. Zed takes <math alttext="4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> hours to perform knee surgery and <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> hour to perform elbow surgery. Which of the following conclusions is supported by the information provided?

choices.label: Dr. Art has a comparative advantage in elbow surgery.
Dr. Zed has a comparative advantage in elbow surgery.
Dr. Zed does not have a comparative advantage in performing either procedure.
Dr. Art does not have a comparative advantage in performing either procedure.
Dr. Zed has an absolute advantage in performing both procedures.

content.answer: Dr. Zed has a comparative advantage in elbow surgery.
